------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The Welcome form.
This form is the application's main form. It's used for letting customers know they're welcome to use the application and it gives options for signing in. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Gets the required creation parameters when the control handle is created. The ClassStyle property is overridden to disable the Close button.
A that contains the required creation parameters when the handle to the control is created.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Values that represent the forms in the application.
The values are used for determining which form the user is currently at and also which form the user wants to navigate to.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

members.member:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The Navigate subroutine.
This subroutine is used for navigating between the forms in the application.
The form that the user wants to navigate to.
The currently displayed form.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The NavigatePrerequisite function.
This function is used to check if the user is required to sign out, sign in, re-enter a password, or choose an Item's details before navigating to a form.
True if the user has to be signed out.
True if the user has to be signed in.
True if the user has to re-enter a password.
True if the user has to select an Item for its details to be displayed.
True if the user meets the prerequisites, false if not. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The ClearShoppingCart subroutine.
This subroutine empties the shopping cart after the user confirms his/her intention.
(Optional) True if the user has to confirm his/her intention to clear the shopping cart.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The AboutApplication subroutine.
This subroutine creates a popup that gives the user some information about the program and the form that is currently displayed.
(Optional) The form that the user wants information about.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The GetSelectedItem subroutine.
This subroutine changes the current item to the selected item in the results list on the catalog form.
The ListBox object on the catalog form.
The search results List from searching on the catalog form.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The CheckOutOfStock function.
This function determines if a product in the catalog is out of stock.
The Item in question.
True if the Item is out of stock, false otherwise. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The GetMatch function.
This function is used for searching for items in the database.
An item in the catalog.
The regular expression search query from the catalog form.
True if a property of the Item matches the regular expression, false otherwise. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The parameterized constructor for creating an Item.
This constructor allows the program to create an Item with properties.
The unique ID of an Item.
The name of an Item.
The price of an Item.
The stock of an Item.
The fee of an Item.
The category of an Item.
The description of an Item.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The parameterized constructor of ShoppingCartItem.
This constructor creates a new ShoppingCartItem with properties set from arguments.
The Item that represents a new ShoppingCartItem.
The quantity of the Item that is being added to the shopping cart.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: E:Furniture_Co.Catalog.Main.User.UserUpdated
member.summary: The UserUpdated event of a User.

members.member:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The SignIn subroutine of a User.
This subroutine changes a User object's properties to that of a user from the database.
The unique ID of a record in the ACCOUNT table in the database.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Values that represent the tabls in the database.
The values are used for determining which table the program wants to read/write to/from when it accesses the database. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: F:Furniture_Co.Catalog.SQL.DatabaseTables.ACCOUNT
member.summary: An enum constant representing the ACCOUNT table.

member.name: F:Furniture_Co.Catalog.SQL.DatabaseTables.PAYMENT
member.summary: An enum constant representing the PAYMENT table.

member.name: F:Furniture_Co.Catalog.SQL.DatabaseTables.PRODUCT
member.summary: An enum constant representing the PRODUCT table.

member.name: F:Furniture_Co.Catalog.SQL.RegexValidate.USERNAME
member.summary: An enum constant representing the Username RegEx.

member.name: F:Furniture_Co.Catalog.SQL.RegexValidate.PASSWORD
member.summary: An enum constant representing the Password RegEx.

member.name: F:Furniture_Co.Catalog.SQL.RegexValidate.EMAIL
member.summary: An enum constant representing the Email RegEx.

member.name: F:Furniture_Co.Catalog.SQL.RegexValidate.OTHER_EMPTY
member.summary: An enum constant representing other data with allowing empty RegEx.

member.name: F:Furniture_Co.Catalog.SQL.RegexValidate.ID
member.summary: An enum constant representing the ID RegEx.

member.name: F:Furniture_Co.Catalog.SQL._cstrDatabaseName
member.summary: The constant string variable for the name of the database.

member.name: F:Furniture_Co.Catalog.SQL._cstrConnection
member.summary: The constant string variable for the connection.

member.name: F:Furniture_Co.Catalog.SQL._cstrCaseInsensitive
member.summary: The constant string for allowing case insensitivity.

members.member:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The CreateSampleProduct subroutine.
This subroutine creates a sample product in the database.
The counter for keeping track of how many sample products are being added to the database.
The name of a sample product.
The price of a sample product.
The stock of a sample product.
The fee of a sample product.
The category of a sample product.
The description of a sample product.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The SQLCreateProduct subroutine.
This subroutine creates a product in the database.
The name of a product.
The price of a product.
The stock of a product.
The fee of a product.
The category of a product.
The description of a product.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The SQLCreatePayment subroutine.
This subroutine creates a new record in the database for information about a payment.
The account ID that made the payment.
The quantity of items for the payment.
The price for the payment.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The SQLCreateAccount subroutine.
This subroutine creates a new account record in the database.
The username of a new account.
The password of a new account.
The first name of a new account.
The last name of a new account.
The email for a new account.
The phone for a new account.
The address for a new account.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The RegexValidateUserData subroutine.
This subroutine validates user input so that bad data isn't used in a SQL statement.
The user input.
The type of data the user inputted.
True if it the regular expression matches the user input, false otherwise. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The SQLGetFieldInfo subroutine.
This subroutine reads information for a field from the database.
An integer representing the table in the database that is being accessed.
The unique ID of a record.
The field in the database that is being read.
(Optional) True for using case sensitivity in the SQL statement, false otherwise.
The value of the field found. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The SQLGetRecordID subroutine.
This subroutine is used for getting the record ID of a record from its specific value in a field.
The table in the database that is being accessed.
The field in the record.
The specific value for the field.
(Optional) True for using case sensitivity in the SQL statement, false otherwise.
The record ID of a record that has a specific value in a field. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The SQLSetFieldInfo subroutine.
This subroutine sets the value of a field in a record in the database.
The table in the database being accessed.
The unique ID of a record.
The field whose value is being changed.
The new value for a field.
(Optional) True for using case sensitivity in the SQL statement, false otherwise.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
